title: RapTarX
author: RapTarX
content: I just have read an article on cointelegraph which claims bitcoin logo had an imperfection which was noticed 2/3 days back.Check out this article- https://cointelegraph.com/news/bitcoin-logo-imperfection-found-on-original-artwork-after-12-years/ampThe logo created by forum member bitboy has created the logo. But someone noticed an unusual scratch on the logo. Haven't anyone noticed this earlier? I can't believe; I guess the scratch is the with a purpose.Thoughts?

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: If there is an archive on bitboy's original logo on HD quality then we can check it if there is. Even the thread's archive[1] has low quality images. I'd only think this is a little bit graphic error from those who traced the logo to become HD or whatever you call it. But still good observation though.[1] https://web.archive.org/web/20131115192058/https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1756.msg21619

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: I don't think there is any big deal in this caseI was just a logo, and we all sure as hell know how it was intended to be. I am not a professional graphics designing, but I did study some fine art and have some talent in art. Such "imperfections" happen at times

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: Since it requires intense supervision to notice the mistake then it's not much a problem. People have been using the bitcoin logo without complaining, so the slight error is not enough to raise an alarm. Interesting how anything about bitcoin make it to the news blogs. Between I thought bitboy is same with the popular youtuber bitboy, but the article states otherwise.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: RapTarX on February 13, 2023, 06:12:53 PMI can't believe; I guess the scratch is the with a purpose.Thoughts?Probably just the fact that the logo creator was like "whatever" and just ignored the minuscule imperfection. Who would've guessed that Bitcoin would gain so much popularity in such a short timespan in the first place. Don't forget that Bitcoin was such a small and niche network at those times.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: I don't think it's a part that needs special attention from the community. If you've ever seen some very large printed bitcoin images on some object on the street where the imperfections of the logo are not visible at all, is that also using the raw logo that Bitboy did or designers even have their own perfect version?Actually, this is not the first time I realized it, a few years ago someone pointed it out on this forum.

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: It is no imperfection. It is a backdoor to the blockchain put there by the devs. If you can manage to get the fitting key, you can access the source code of the Zio-I mean bitcoin but I don't recommend this because you may screw the balance of the universe. Think about all the children that will starve because their parents can't reach their coins. Luckily for you, neither you nor any of us have to worry about that because these keys are in the safe hands, the bitcoin devs.

I am not a professional graphics designing, but I did study some fine art and have some talent in art. Such "imperfections" happen at timesÂ  I also don't think its a big deal either all the great painting have flaws in them, but this Bitcoin logo is ignorable as long as the blockchain is working perfectly and there's no disruption it has had no impact on the community, in the past the community's motivation is on propagating and promoting the use of Cryptocurrency that they did not have time to look for imperfection on the official logo.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: After all imperfections are part of the originality of the logo, making it even more unique. It's an interesting curiosity for bitcoin enthusists. From now on, we know that a bitcoin logo to be trustworthy to its origins, it must have an imperfection, otherwise it's a cheap imitation.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: That's very interesting thing. Maybe it's a bit strange that nobody haven't noticed this tiny detail in all these years. Now it's main question, did author of logo left that detail intentionally, or it was mistake. It would be interesting if @bitboy would come here and answer it. He haven't posted anything since 2014, but he did loged in to forum last September.I wouldn't call it imperfection. I would say that Bitcoin logo is imperfectly perfect .

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: It's trivial, of course. But it's amusing how both @_Bosch_ and @skyler_fs have noticed these inconsequential imperfections in the Bitcoin logo. That imperfect curvature is funnier, though. These microscopic discoveries are either accidental or these two must have so much time to spare that they started to zoom in on the Bitcoin logo to look for something interesting. LOL!Anyway, had bitboy known that Bitcoin would grow to be this huge, he would probably have polished the logo more.

comments.author: ultrloa
comments.body: imperfections sometimes create huge value to some creations but to the case of bitcoin its doesn't have anything to make it as a big deal since for sure this logo is created intended to make it somehow unique to the eyes of people who could see it and easy to remember as it is.Maybe some perfectionist notice something which caught there attention but for sure majority didn't take anything damn about the possible flaws or imperfection about the logo.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Such journalistic investigations are more eye-catching than useful reports. Is there a single, agreed-upon standard for the Bitcoin logo?I see that some sites use different shapes and some sites are different from others, but in general and without discrimination, you can know that this symbol refers to the Bitcoin currency.Then you are talking about design since 2010 and the design tools were not that developed.Thank God it wasn't done by Satoshi, the theories would have deepened.

comments.author: Synchronice
comments.body: It's pretty strange that graphics designers haven't noticed that because they would have been in touch with this logo during the working process. By the way, was this flaw so important that it gained so much attention?I wonder if bitboy's account is hacked or not. His last post comes from February 10, 2014 while he was recently active on September 22, 2022. I wonder if this news reaches to this person and he comes back He is definitely alive because his original bitcoin wallet isn't abandoned: 1BcQPKcvgLtBp8ZrRSHWewpd3h97BqEQb3This forum is quite a strange place. A person comes out of nowhere and creates revolutionary coin, then somehow he disappears and another person becomes a forum owner, then someone comes out of nowhere with logo for bitcoin and it becomes a global standard. I really have to analyze and learn this forum.

comments.author: aylabadia05
comments.body: The author of the article made by Arijit Sarkar has been viewed by 40,989 and 27 times forwarded, he said there were two imperfect line angles on the Bitcoin logo image said to be made by bitboy.I consider that the article published more than a few days ago on cointelegraph is a form of concern for Bitcoin.Bitcoin is so great that it has captured the attention of many people so that even the slightest flaws in a logo like the one published on cointelegraph are widely discussed.I agree with this one mate.Quote from: ultrloa on February 17, 2023, 11:32:57 AMimperfections sometimes create huge value to some creations but to the case of bitcoin its doesn't have anything to make it as a big deal since for sure this logo is created intended to make it somehow unique to the eyes of people who could see it and easy to remember as it is.Maybe some perfectionist notice something which caught there attention but for sure majority didn't take anything damn about the possible flaws or imperfection about the logo.

comments.body: Quote from: aylabadia05 on February 18, 2023, 05:07:17 AMThe author of the article made by Arijit Sarkar has been viewed by 40,989 and 27 times forwarded, he said there were two imperfect line angles on the Bitcoin logo image said to be made by bitboy.I consider that the article published more than a few days ago on cointelegraph is a form of concern for Bitcoin.Bitcoin is so great that it has captured the attention of many people so that even the slightest flaws in a logo like the one published on cointelegraph are widely discussed.Additionally Bitcoin logo can be changed by anyone since no one controlling it. The majority opinion is what makes that current logo official but now we can use any logo that we like because the creator is not active anymore to lead on the official changes like this.In reality Bitcoin has many logo as long as the BTC sign is noticeable.
